attributes.action: Make every County Council organise safe litter picking events during isolation
attributes.additional_details: While the UK faces self-isolation, the amount of litter being created in this country is likely to be much less, which makes this a great opportunity to reduce the negative effects of unnecessary plastics on our landscape, water and soil. Of course, every volunteer would be confirmed COVID-19 negative and comfortable to walk within a radius of a few miles of their home in order to pick. This would also be a good opportunity for socialisation and exercise in this otherwise isolating time.
attributes.background: During this current period of self-isolation in the UK, the Government should encourage every County Council in the country to organise small, safe litter-picking events in order to reduce litter's impact on the environment in a time when it is being significantly less produced.

rejection.details:
Litter and refuse collection is a matter for individual local authorities, and not the Government or Parliament. You could contact your own local authority and suggest that they organise litter collection events.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: 
www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
